update.description:
This adds the ability to copy/move global groups (see issue #43) to the right-click menu. 

Copying is really handy if you want to setup a new type of experiment using a bunch of the same globals but with different values or if you are tying out new values and want to keep the old one(backups are always great). 

Moving can help with splitting huge global files into smaller ones.

Copies are automatically named NAME_copy. If this name should already exist they are named NAME_copy(#) where # increments  until free name is found.

Moved groups get a suffix if a group group with the same name should already exist in the new file.
The suffix is (#) where # increments until free name is found.

![screenshot.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/6g5bg5/images/3167270748-screenshot.png)
update.title: Copy and move global groups

content.html: Excellent. Let's wait until the qtutils 2.0 merge and then we can change the two QtGui.QMenu lines to QtWidgets.QMenu and merge this one in.

update.description:
This adds the ability to copy/move global groups (see issue #43) to the right-click menu. 

Copying is really handy if you want to setup a new type of experiment using a bunch of the same globals but with different values or if you are tying out new values and want to keep the old one(backups are always great). 

Moving can help with splitting huge global files into smaller ones.

Copies are automatically named NAME_copy. If this name should already exist they are named NAME_copy(#) where # increments  until free name is found.

Moved groups get a suffix if a group group with the same name should already exist in the new file.
The suffix is (#) where # increments until free name is found.

![screenshot.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/6g5bg5/images/3167270748-screenshot.png)
update.title: Copy and move global groups

content.raw: `move` should probably be `delete_source_group` then as well
content.html: move should probably be delete_source_group then as well

content.raw:
This is looking good. We should add a similar feature at some point to move globals between groups.

This is  a nitpick, but could  you change the variable names `globals_file`/`new_globals_file` and `groupname`/`new_groupname` to `source_globals_file`/`dest_globals_file` and `source_groupname`/`dest_groupname`?

Calling it a 'new' file makes it sound like a file is being created, which could be confusing among other functions, some of which are creating new files. The target group is actually being created, so it's less inaccurate to call it 'new', but the convention for move and copy operations alike in most software I've seen is to call one "source_thing" and one "dest_thing" (both the `mv` and `cp` commands call their arguments this for example).
content.html:
This is looking good. We should add a similar feature at some point to move globals between groups.

This is a nitpick, but could you change the variable names globals_file/new_globals_file and groupname/new_groupname to source_globals_file/dest_globals_file and source_groupname/dest_groupname?

Calling it a 'new' file makes it sound like a file is being created, which could be confusing among other functions, some of which are creating new files. The target group is actually being created, so it's less inaccurate to call it 'new', but the convention for move and copy operations alike in most software I've seen is to call one "source_thing" and one "dest_thing" (both the mv and cp commands call their arguments this for example).

content.raw:
Ok so I added a context menu(the code isn't nice and clean I'll refactor later) and the code seems to be quite simple, but for some reason line l1822 seems to not work.

```
#!python

action = copy_menu.addAction(filename, lambda: self.on_groups_copy_selected_groups_triggered(str(filepath)))

```
All actions are linked to the same filename(last in the list) and I don't know why. Any Ideas?

Update: Fixed it!

content.raw:
Mh I'm of the mindset that this feature is done and the move/copy to other file stuff is a separate feature thus separate pull request. But sure we can do them both here.

I'll give the proposed changes (with context menu) a shot later today.

Mh I'm of the mindset that this feature is done and the move/copy to other file stuff is a separate feature thus separate pull request. But sure we can do them both here.

content.raw:
Since this is a new feature I think we should get it right in this pull request, rather than splitting it over two (since a second pull request is likely to change this one significantly)

I think there are actually 2 features here that are intertwined: One for copying global groups, and the other for moving them. I think they'll share code on how to manipulate the h5 file (since copy is just move without the final delete step).

With this in mind, while draggable is cool, it only does one of them (move) unless you start involving keyboard modifiers. This is probably overkill for the moment. A hierarchical context menu could be good (a copy-to and move-to menu that expands out to a list of open HDF5 files). I'd also be OK with one or two icons, that create a context menu with the list of HDF5 files so the feature is more obvious.

The list of HDF5 filenames should also consider the possibility that two files will have the same filename, but be in different directories. We should display the minimal amount of information necessary to distinguish the files (so if any two filenames match, add the parent directory recursively to the displayed name until they no longer match)
content.html:
Since this is a new feature I think we should get it right in this pull request, rather than splitting it over two (since a second pull request is likely to change this one significantly)

I think there are actually 2 features here that are intertwined: One for copying global groups, and the other for moving them. I think they'll share code on how to manipulate the h5 file (since copy is just move without the final delete step).

With this in mind, while draggable is cool, it only does one of them (move) unless you start involving keyboard modifiers. This is probably overkill for the moment. A hierarchical context menu could be good (a copy-to and move-to menu that expands out to a list of open HDF5 files). I'd also be OK with one or two icons, that create a context menu with the list of HDF5 files so the feature is more obvious.

The list of HDF5 filenames should also consider the possibility that two files will have the same filename, but be in different directories. We should display the minimal amount of information necessary to distinguish the files (so if any two filenames match, add the parent directory recursively to the displayed name until they no longer match)

content.raw:
I thought about that and came to the conclusion that I have no idea how to properly do the UX for this.
Here are some options:

We could do something like have a hierarchical context menu. 

We could do a popup asking for the file (I hate this one even more)

We could keep it the way it is and make groups draggable between files (seperate pullrequest?) this is harder but seems to be the right approach to me.
content.html:
I thought about that and came to the conclusion that I have no idea how to properly do the UX for this. Here are some options:

We could do something like have a hierarchical context menu.

We could do a popup asking for the file (I hate this one even more)

We could keep it the way it is and make groups draggable between files (seperate pullrequest?) this is harder but seems to be the right approach to me.

content.raw: I think you should generalise slightly so you can copy groups between h5 files as well (if you aren't already aware, you can pull globals from multiple h5 files for the one experiment so runmanager supports having multiple h5 files open at once)
content.html: I think you should generalise slightly so you can copy groups between h5 files as well (if you aren't already aware, you can pull globals from multiple h5 files for the one experiment so runmanager supports having multiple h5 files open at once)

content.raw:
I'm open to the idea if combing new_group and copy_group into one function (in main.py). I did this first but I didn't like all the if s I had to sprinkle in there. Thoughts?
Maybe we should split the "Insert the newly created globals group into the model" part into it's own function?
content.html: I'm open to the idea if combing new_group and copy_group into one function (in main.py). I did this first but I didn't like all the if s I had to sprinkle in there. Thoughts? Maybe we should split the "Insert the newly created globals group into the model" part into it's own function?
